sub_title: Senior manager external reporting and compliance
summary:
Professional experience
•	Overall SOX program manager ASML
•	Manager external reporting and compliance

November 2018 – Current

Benno is responsible for managing the SOX compliance program at ASML and reporting to the internal control committee (ICC). He is the primary contact person for the ICC and the external auditor. Benno is also external reporting and compliance specialist for US GAAP and IFRS technical accounting topics related to treasury and tax management

•	Manager internal control and continuous monitoring
•	Member of the Process Control Board

January 2018 – November 2018

Benno is responsible for managing SOX and internal control compliance at ASML. He established a new control framework and work instructions for sales, sourcing control and corporate tax due to adoption of ASC 606 (US GAAP equivalent of IFRS 15), ASC 842 (US GAAP equivalent of IFRS 16) and revisions in ASC 740 (US GAAP equivalent of IAS 12). 

• Senior Manager

September 2015 – January 2018

Benno's main client experience is both in the upstream and downstream oil business and the defense industry. His main audit clients are listed clients and large multinationals. 
Benno’s main upstream clients are engaged in major oil and gas projects in the world like Sakhalin II, Qatargas I and E&P blocks in the Middle East. Downstream experience is focused on refinery and retail in Europe.

Experience in the defense industry is mainly with companies engaged in landsystems, marine and radarsystems.

• Manager

September 2012 – September 2015

Benno has extensive knowledge and experience in group accounting as group auditor and component auditor and in joint venture accounting, working with international teams and specialists. Benno has experience with  reporting in accordance with IFRS, US GAAP including SOX and Dutch GAAP. Benno’s client portfolio consists of international clients in  Dubai, Qatar, Thailand, Japan, US, Germany, France, UK and the Netherlands.
